doc.after: English botanist and artist Henry Charles Andrews described Persoonia linearis in 1799, in the second volume of his Botanists Repository, Comprising Colour'd Engravings of New and Rare Plants.[1] He had been given a plant in flower by J. Robertson of Stockwell, who had grown it from seed in 1794.[2] The species name is the Latin linearis "linear", referring to the shape of the leaves.[3]
